name: df-mir
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3
body: |- wceq(cmir, cmpt(s0, universe, cmpt(s1, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), cmpt(s2, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), crio(s3, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), wa(wceq(co(cv(s1), cfv(cds, cv(s0)), cv(s3)), co(cv(s1), cfv(cds, cv(s0)), cv(s2))), wcel(cv(s1), co(cv(s3), cfv(citv, cv(s0)), cv(s2)))))))))
bodyPretty: ‚ä¢ pInvG =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶(s1 ‚àà(Base ` s0)‚Ü¶(s2 ‚àà(Base ` s0)‚Ü¶ iota(s3 ‚àà(Base ` s0),((s1[(dist ` s0)]s3)=(s1[(dist ` s0)]s2)‚àß s1 ‚àà(s3[(Itv ` s0)]s2))))))
comment: Define the point inversion ("mirror") function. Definition 7.5 of [Schwabhauser] p. 49. See ~ mirval and ~ ismir . (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 30-May-2019.)
